clients.q: How do you differ from a blogger exchange or a regular agency?
clients.a:
We don't sell 'blogger placement'. We sell content production and distribution.

Regular agencies look for one blogger with a million followers, pay them $1000 and hope for result. We use the same money to hire 50 micro-creators who create 50 different videos. This gives 10x more reach through Reels/TikTok algorithms and reduces risks. If one video doesn't 'hit', the other 49 will.

cases.challenge: A cosmetics brand faced high customer acquisition costs (CAC) in classic targeting. They needed to increase awareness of a new serum line and create 'social proof'.
cases.solution: We selected 50 micro-influencers with an 'aesthetic' appearance. Each received a brief to create an ASMR unboxing and demonstrate the skin's glow effect. Content was published over 2 weeks.
cases.fullStory: This case showed that for the beauty segment, visual aesthetics and 'natural' reviews are more important than follower counts. ASMR videos showed the highest watch depth.

cases.challenge: Launching a complex technical gadget in the market. Users did not understand the value of the product from static banners.
cases.solution: A series of 'Lifehack' videos where creators showed how the gadget solves everyday problems. Used dynamic editing and trending sounds.
cases.fullStory: Focusing on functionality and 'real-life' demonstration allowed to generate demand within a week that exceeded all pre-order expectations.

cases.challenge: The sports nutrition market is oversaturated. It was necessary to stand out from competitors and enter the 'healthy lifestyle' segment.
cases.solution: We launched a challenge among fitness trainers and sports enthusiasts. They created recipes using the brand's protein. This created a 'pro choice' effect.
cases.fullStory: Using different body types and fitness levels of creators helped the brand become 'one of their own' for a wide audience, not just for professional athletes.
